adviseScripts.text: When you're booking tickets for a theater,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: which seats do you prefer?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: The ones closest to the stage.
Anywhere is fine.
I thought you'd say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That's good, because
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I asked for some VIP tickets in advance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You can use them the next time you come to see the show.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: So you don't care one way or the other...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I was thinking about getting you some VIP tickets if you wanted to sit close to the stage.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But I guess that won't be necessary...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I talked more about her performances.
One of the theater employees told me now is the best time to take a vacation.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If you had some time off, what would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Stay at home and sleep in.
Travel far away to somewhere exotic.
Wait.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You can do that any day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You don't need vacation time for that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I don't get it...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Going off to a distant place...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That would be nice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure there'd be all sorts of exotic scenery and music to take in.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I discussed our hypothetical vacation plans.
If you have to choose between wealth and fame,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: which one will you pick?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Fame.
I don't need either of them.
Oh, really? It seems that fame is of great importance to you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I didn't think fame would mean much to you since you are always seen talking to numerous Nikkes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: So I admit I'm a little surprised.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I knew you'd say that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Just like you, music holds more importance to me than them both.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure there's something you value more than fame and wealth.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continue to discuss the most important things in our lives.
I was walking to a station at the Outpost,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: when I heard this awful singing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Did something happen there?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: It's home to a tone-deaf ghost.
It's home to a poor soul who has forgotten how to sing.
Maestro, you know as well as I do
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: that ghosts aren't real.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That's so sad!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Although their singing truly was awful, I feel so bad for them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Can you invite them to my next show?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I talked more about how to cure tone-deafness.
Do you think the beginning
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: or the ending of a song is more important?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: The beginning.
The end.
I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If I can't get into a song right away,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: the rest of it doesn't come outright.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: For me, the beginning of a song is when I'm most immersed in it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Yeah... The end is important, too.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But I care more about the beginning.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If I can't get into a song right away,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: the rest of it doesn't come outright.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria gives me some pointers on how to immerse yourself in the music when singing.
Maestro,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: if we ever reclaim the surface, what's the first thing you'll do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Find higher ground and shout to the heavens that we have retaken the surface.
Find higher ground and sing.
You paint quite the pretty picture.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I can feel how much it means to you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I wonder what your voice would sound like expressing such joy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If I ever have the chance, I'd love to hear it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You? Sing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You don't need to say that to make me happy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: When the time comes, you can leave the singing to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You can be free to celebrate any way you like.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I imagined various scenarios of us reclaiming the surface.
Volume's music really packs a punch.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I think adding some tougher lyrics would give it even more of an impact.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Maestro, are you a fan of hard-hitting music?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I am. It helps me identify with Volume.
I can't really identify with the emotions being expressed in that kind of music.
The most important thing is that our music expresses our true selves.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: It's not about the styles of the music.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I see that you understand that perfectly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I thought you had an eclectic taste in music.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But I can see how those emotions could be unfamiliar to some people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I suppose that's why they call it a preference.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continued listening to Volume's music.
Among us musicians, Noise has the closest ties with the masses.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Actually, she cares what the public thinks so much, that it can sometimes cause her to get into a funk.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If she was feeling down when you saw her, what would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'd try to cheer her up.
I wouldn't do anything. It's the path she chose.
... Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If it were me, I wouldn't do anything.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: This is the path she chose.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: She's aware of the downsides.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Good answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: This is the path that she chose. She has to take the good with the bad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Besides, Noise won't give up just because she's down in the dumps.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: She'll weather the storm. I'm sure of it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continued listening to Noise's music.
What a nice day!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I want to do something exciting. Something spontaneous.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: How about you take a break from practice?
Try to practice singing outdoors.
Oh no, I can't do that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'm afraid that's not an option.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That... could be fun, I guess.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: It'd be a nice change of pace, and it could help me get more out of my practice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I went outdoors with Aria.
I run through the gamut of emotions while on stage.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But the strongest of them is still loneliness.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: The unfolding stories, the expectation of the audience, and the arrangement made with everyone. All of this is up on me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You'll always have your music, Aria.
You'll always have me, Aria.
... That's right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Music can help me forget my loneliness.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: So actually, I'm not alone at all.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But you're not on stage with me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Perhaps we could perform together one day, but the chances of that are slim to none.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Are you even listening to what I'm saying?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria shares with me the feelings she experiences while on stage.
Opera is a genre of great antiquity.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Songs conducted centuries ago are still being sung today.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: What do you think its secret is?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: What was once old always becomes new again.
Opera is eternal.
Actually... I was thinking just the opposite.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Opera has never changed to fit with any trend. It's always stood alone.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: My thoughts exactly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Not everything changes with the passage of time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Beautiful melodies, love, and so on...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continued talking about opera.
I had a debate with my director not long ago.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: He and I have a difference of opinion regarding my music.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If it were you, what would you do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'd give in to the director.
I'd try to convince him that I was right.
Yes, that would certainly resolve the argument.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: After all, there's no such thing as a perfect performance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: My thoughts exactly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: It's okay for the director to have his own opinion.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If he can't convince me, however, I'm convinced that my performance will suffer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I thought about ways to resolve this disagreement within the troupe.
Love is an indispensable topic in opera.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: But as you know, romantic scenes are not my strong suit.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Someone even said once that I didn't look human during an emotional scene.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: What can I do to improve?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Try to open your heart to someone.
Just focus on the music.
Well...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Even if I was in a relationship with someone,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure it wouldn't live up to everyone's expectations.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That's a great idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I can use music to evoke emotions within me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'll try that next time. Thank you!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I discuss how love can be expressed.
There's a tenor who was practicing a duet with me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: He kept fumbling his lines.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: And because he was so hard on himself, he only ended up making more mistakes...
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: What should I do to help him?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Let him handle it on his own.
How about you make flub some notes to make him feel less awkward?
I think that's about the only thing I can do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Besides, I am not comfortable dealing with other people's feelings.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: No. I never make mistakes.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'm incapable of it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continued thinking up different ways to help other people.
Do you prefer
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: comedies or tragedies?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Comedy.
Tragedy.
I like comedy more, as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: However, my favorite opera is not a comedy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Every writer has their magnum opus.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: In my opinion, most of those tend to be tragedies.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If the writing is up to par, tragic stories appeal to me more
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I discussed what kind of operas we prefer.
Protagonists in opera series tend to end up at their final destinations.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Their death is what completes the show.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Have you ever considered what the perfect death would be?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Sacrificing yourself for a noble cause.
There's no such thing as a "perfect death".
... I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If a protagonist is willing to give their lives to protect something,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: they must have found a greater purpose in life, something more valuable than their own life.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Dying a heroic death is more admirable than living in shame.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Are you saying that death is meaningless, no matter what?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You're not exactly a romantic, I'll say that much.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I discussed philosophy with Aria for a while.
Maestro, you're constantly surrounded by women.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Are any of them your type?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You are, Aria.
I don't know.
I would be honored
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: to be your muse.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: You're so indecisive, {AccountData.NickName}.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Men and women who excel in the realm of seduction are said to be very charming,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: but when it's all said and done, all they end up with are regrets
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I continued to discuss similarly profound topics.
Sometimes I feel like taking a sabbatical from opera.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: What are some recreational activities I could have fun with?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Rock climbing.
Go sing some karaoke.
An opera singer that likes rock climbing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I'd become a laughingstock if the media caught wind of it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: ... Hmm.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: It would be nice to sing something that's not my typical style.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: All right, let's go sing some karaoke!
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I recommended even more activities to Aria.
Maestro, have you ever hit a snag before?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Of course, it's common.
I don't think I have.
Hitting a bottleneck prevents you from progressing any further.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: However, once you manage to get past them, you're better off for it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: When you think about it, they're actually a great learning opportunity.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: ... Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Maybe it's because you always try to avoid them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: By going around them though, you may be missing a chance to become better at what you do.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Aria and I discussed different methods of self-improvement.
Let's say you're an opera composer,
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: and your tastes are directly opposed to what the public wants to see.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: In the end, who would you compose for?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: For myself.
For the public.
... I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: If you work at it hard enough, you'll eventually reach the top of your respective field.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: The question is, when you reach the top, did you get there by being true to yourself or by appealing to the masses?
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: ... That's an old-fashioned answer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: That's a treacherous path as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: Even the most talented of artists struggle trying to capture what audiences want.
adviseScripts.speaker: Aria

adviseScripts.text: I continued to discuss the arduous life of an artist with Aria.
